intro: Cacosmia rugosa var. rugosa, commonly known as the rough cacosmia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically a vibrant pink or red color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
